In practice this trade - off is easily observed , by noticing how the training error can be driven to zero by using a rich hypothesis class , which typically results into overfitting and increased test error .In the context of statistical machine translation ( SMT ) , where large bilingual corpora are used to train adaptive software to translate text , this task is further complicated by the peculiar distribution underlying the data , where the probability of encountering new words or expressions never vanishes .
